intro: Ptarmica sachokiana, commonly known as the white mountain grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in umbels. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine regions, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional herbal medicine. Ptarmica sachokiana plays an important ecological role in stabilizing mountainous terrain and supporting local biodiversity.
